item.title: Grishma add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Grishma add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "A short story is a different thing all together - a short story is like a kiss in the dark from a stranger." -- Stephen King

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Peter De Vries
item.description: "I love being a writer. What I can't stand is the paperwork." -- Peter De Vries

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I could not sit seriously down to write a serious Romance under any other motive than to save my life, & if it were indispensable for me to keep it up & never relax into laughing at myself or other people, I am sure I should be hung before I had finished the first chapter. No - I must keep my own style & go on in my own way; and though I may never succeed again in that, I am convinced that I should totally fail in any other." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "You can fix anything but a blank page." -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "A professional writer is an amateur who didn't quit." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Aaron Sorkin
item.description: "I love writing, but hate starting. The page is awfully white and it says, 'You may have fooled some of the people some of the time but those days are over, Giftless. I'm not your agent and I'm not your mommy: I'm a white piece of paper. You wanna dance with me?' and I really, really don't. I'll go peaceable-like." -- Aaron Sorkin

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Iris Murdoch
item.description: "Writing is like getting married. One should never commit oneself until one is amazed at one's luck." -- Iris Murdoch

item.title: Grishma add a quote by George Eliot
item.description:
"Poor fellow! I think he is in love with you.'
I am not aware of it. And to me it is one of the most odious things in a girl's life, that there must always be some supposition of falling in love coming between her and any man who is kind to her... I have no ground for the nonsensical vanity of fancying everybody who comes near me is in love with me." -- George Eliot

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "The reason that fiction is more interesting than any other form of literature, to those who really like to study people, is that in fiction the author can really tell the truth without humiliating himself." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "Writing is a way of talking without being interrupted." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Pico Iyer
item.description: "Writing is, in the end, that oddest of anomalies: an intimate letter to a stranger." -- Pico Iyer

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Tom Bissell
item.description: "A great writer reveals the truth even when he or she does not wish to." -- Tom Bissell

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A person who can write a long letter with ease, cannot write ill." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I am not at all in a humor for writing; I must write on till I am." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Oh! write, write. Finish it at once. Let there be an end of this suspense. Fix, commit, condemn yourself." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Any word you have to hunt for in a thesaurus is the wrong word. There are no exceptions to this rule." -- Stephen King

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Grishma add a quote by Don Roff
item.description: "Nothing's a better cure for writer's block than to eat ice cream right out of the carton." -- Don Roff
